column4: so nobody knows how to at least disable gnomes nm-applet in kde sessions without uninstalling it?

i noticed that gnome and kde's nm applets wehre both running for me under gnome.. so i closed kde's and told the gnome sessions  to not start it.. Perhaps kde's session manager tool has similer thing.
why would you want to do that?
why does it matter?  There are Koisk type extensions for firefox if you just want a 'web koisk' box.
I don't, I just want it to have a guest session as advertised for when I let people use my laptop ;)
ive never seen a guest session advertised.. except on the live cds I just make a guest account for them to use on my installed systems
oh wait.. i do see a Guest Session in the menus :) never noticed it befor
it was one of the main selling points of 8.10 (not to me but they tried to sell that feature a bunch)
i dont recall it beingmentioned much at all..  I just saw guest session now in the menus of that user-applet - that ive rarely used
i just tried it.. and it dident even work. :)
oh, I had to install gdm_guest_session package :)

I got a guest session in the user applet, but on the gdm screen theres no mention of guest session.  the applet dosent work.. so not sure if it even works at all I recall some check box somewhere about it.
heh - i just made a account namde 'guest' and leave a postit note on the pc saying.. Login: as guest, password guest. :)
now you can (somehow) let them log in without a password as guest and it will erase everything they did in that session when they log out ^^
